page.title: 01THE AREA AROUND TONYPANDY
page.content: The population of the area is approximately 10,000 spread throughout several small towns and villages: Gelli, Bodringallt, Ystrad, Pontrhondda,Trealaw, Llwynypia, Blaenclydach, Cwmclydach and Tonypandy. The main town is Tonypandy,famous for its prominent past in formulating the industrial and political life of the Rhondda and is the hub of Rhondda's varied and numerous activities. Coal no longer dominates the landscape or employment, there is not a single coalmine left in the area. Unemployment runs at a high level and very few new factories have come to the area. Most of the people live in neat rows of terraced houses clinging to the steep valley side. Welsh is no longer the dominant language.
